column4: hi all, on a recent install of ubuntu 8.04 with an x1600 graphics card, xvideo output is not working
ï»¿i was under the impression that the default open source drivers for radeon r500 card in ubuntu supported xvideo
in the hope that a reinstallation might make xv work
what gpu are you using? and what's wrong with xv?
it is an ati rv530 [radeon x1600], xvinfo reports no adatpers found
xv with the restricted driver has horrible tearing, i get video corruption and i just dont like the closed source drivers at all
thats not the point, the open source drivers for rv530 cards have perfectly working xv support
well what drivers are you using right now
shall i specify driver "ati" in the video card section of xorg.conf
it might be using vesa by default
ok will be back in a bit
